citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process starting at 8:45 AM on
25-JAN-2024.
The inspectors arrived at the closed outer gate of the facility at 8:45 AM and attempted to make contact via phone call and
text message to the licensee however there was no reply – the inspector left a voice message in addition to the text
message. A phone call to a second facility contact (farm manager) was made at 8:49 AM, the call was unanswered and
the voicemailbox was full so the inspector was unable to leave a message. A text message to the same secondary
contact was sent at 9:09 AM, to which there was no reply. The inspector called a third facility contact (office manager) at
8:50 AM however there was no reply, the inspector left a voicemail message requesting a return call. The inspectors
waited at the outer gate of the facility from 8:45 AM to 9:19am. The inspectors stood outside of their vehicles multiple
times while waiting at the outer gate. They honked the horns of their vehicles approximately six times while waiting. After
waiting 34 minutes, with no reply from the licensee or additional facility contacts, a phone call was made (voicemail left)
and a text message was sent to the licensee at 9:19 AM notifying them that the inspectors were leaving the area and
requested the licensee contact the inspector as soon as possible.
Additional Inspectors:
MARY ANN MCBRIDE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
2.126(b)  Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process starting at 8:45 AM on 
25-JAN-2024.  
 
The inspectors arrived at the closed outer gate of the facility at 8:45 AM and attempted to make contact via phone call and 
text message to the licensee however there was no reply – the inspector left a voice message in addition to the text 
message. A phone call to a second facility contact (farm manager) was made at 8:49 AM, the call was unanswered and 
the voicemailbox was full so the inspector was unable to leave a message. A text message to the same secondary 
contact was sent at 9:09 AM, to which there was no reply. The inspector called a third facility contact (office manager) at 
8:50 AM however there was no reply, the inspector left a voicemail message requesting a return call. The inspectors 
waited at the outer gate of the facility from 8:45 AM to 9:19am. The inspectors stood outside of their vehicles multiple 
times while waiting at the outer gate. They honked the horns of their vehicles approximately six times while waiting. After 
waiting 34 minutes, with no reply from the licensee or additional facility contacts, a phone call was made (voicemail left) 
and a text message was sent to the licensee at 9:19 AM notifying them that the inspectors were leaving the area and 
requested the licensee contact the inspector as soon as possible. 
 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MARY ANN MCBRIDE, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
